name: U.S. Music Chart Records Quiz | No. 1 Hits | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which artist has had the most number 1 songs?
questions.explanation:
The Beatles.

	The Beatles (20), Elvis Presley (18), Mariah Carey (14) and Michael Jackson (13).

questions.text: Which artist had the longest time between their first top 40 hit and their first number 1 song?
questions.explanation:
Santana.

	Santana (29 years), Aerosmith (23 years), Tina Turner (24 years), Mariah Carey (hit number 1 with first song).

questions.text: Which song spent the most weeks at number 2 without hitting number 1?
questions.correct: Waiting For a Girl Like You by Foreigner
options: How Do I Live by Leann Rimes
Say It Isn't So by Hall and Oates
Proud Mary by Credence Clearwater Revival
questions.explanation:
Waiting For a Girl Like You by Foreigner.

	Waiting for a Girl Like You spent 10 weeks at number 2. It was kept out of the top spot by Physical by Olivia Newton John. How do I Live and Say it Isn't So both spent 4 weeks at number 2 while Proud Mary spent 3 weeks. Credence Clearwater Revival does hold the record for most number 2 songs without hitting number 1 with 5 number 2 songs.

questions.text: What chart record is held by the song 'Young Love'?
questions.correct: Only song to replace itself at number 1 but by a different artist
questions.explanation:
Only song to replace itself at number 1 but by a different artist.

	In 1956, Sonny James and Tab Hunter had back to back number 1 songs with different versions of Young Love.

questions.text: Which artist had the longest title in terms of words for a non-medley song?
questions.explanation:
Ray Stevens.

	The song was 'Jeremiah Peabody's Poly Unsaturated Quick Dissolving Fast Acting Pleasant Tasting Green and Purple Pills'?

questions.text: Which surname has the most entries as an Artist (Note: If an artist has more then 1 hit, it only counts at one entry)?
questions.explanation:
Brown.

	Brown (15), Jackson (14), Jones (13), and Stewart (8). The entries are Al Brown's Tunetoppers, Arthur Brown, Bobby Brown, Boots Brown, Buster Brown, Chuck Brown, Foxy Brown, James Brown, Maxine Brown, Nappy Brown, Peter Brown, Polly Brown, Roy Brown, Ruth Brown, and Shirley Brown. This doesn't even include Jackson Browne who I did not count because the spelling was different.

questions.text: Which Artist started their career with the most consecutive number 1 songs?
questions.explanation:
Mariah Carey.

	Mariah Carey started her career with 5 straight number 1 songs.

questions.text: Which song has hit the top 40 in the most versions by different artists?
questions.explanation:
The Banana Boat Song (Day-O).

	The Banana Boat Song has had 6 different versions hit the top 40. The artist were Tarriers, Harry Belafonte, Fontaine Sisters, Steve Lawrence, Sarah Vaughan and Stan Freberg. What even more amazing about this is that all of these songs hit in the year 1957.

questions.text: Which group hold the chart record for the shortest artist name?
questions.explanation:
M.

	Yes M hit with Pop Muzik.

questions.text: Which song spent the most weeks at number 1?
questions.correct: One Sweet Day by Mariah Carey and Boyz II Men
options: I Will Always Love You by Whitney Houston
Candle in the Wind 1997 by Elton John
questions.explanation:
One Sweet Day by Mariah Carey and Boyz II Men.

	One Fine Day spent 16 weeks at number 1 while the other 3 only spent 14 weeks at number 1.
